Dialogue:
AC: Hello there! Hi!
AA: Hello!
AC: Today, I want to talk about my student days!
AA: Shall we look back?
AC: Let's talk about our student days!
AA: Is it a class?
AC: Are you serious?
AA: I don't have other memorable memories.
AC: What about club activities or first love?
AA: What about your student days?
AC: It was a club activity. We were living our youth!
AA: Youth.
AC: Right! A romance with my senior!
AA: Tell me more.
AC: My first date, hehe.
AA: Interesting.
AC: On my first date, I tripped on the stairs at the station.
AA: No way.
AC: I have never been so embarrassed before or since!
AA: Senpai creeped out?
AC: Right? It felt awkward and just faded away.
AA: Maybe it was cute.
AC: High school students don't seem to have that much adult composure.
AA: Adult composure is important.
AC: Is that so? So, is your current romance also quite thrilling and keeping you on your toes?
AA: I've never been in love.
AC: Next time we meet, I'm going to ask you all about it.
AA: Let's continue the conversation.
AC: Please look forward to it! Well then, until next time!
AA: Until next time.

AC: Hello!  
AA: Hello!  
AC: Been to the 100 yen shop recently?  
AA: Yes, got cleaning supplies.  
AC: Cleaning what?  
AA: Water pipe cleaner. Just put it in.  
AC: Didn't know it was 100 yen.  
AA: Only at 100-yen stores.  
AC: Happens often, 'you get what you pay for.'  
AA: True, not everything is top quality.  
AC: Realized it recently.  
AA: Example?  
AC: Bought a calculator. Broke in a month.  
AA: 100 yen, 30 days of use.  
AC: Makes it worse.  
AA: Noted.  
AC: Spend over 1,000 yen, lasts 20 years.  
AA: A 100-yen lesson.  
AC: Staying positive.  
AA: 100 yen shop browsing is fun.  
AC: Lots of interesting items.  
AA: Always new finds.  
AC: Many convenient kitchen utensils too.  
AA: Absolutely. Shop there first when moving.  
AC: What have you bought?  
AA: Tongs that cut and serve as a bowl.  
AC: Tongs and a bowl! Big?  
AA: Normal size, drains pasta.  
AC: Convenient! I'll look for it at Daiso.  
AA: Please do.

AC: Hello! Nice to meet you.  
AA: Hello.  
AC: Do you have insurance?  
AA: My mother arranged some for me.  
AC: Your mom sounds kind and reliable.  
AA: I often feel like I'm easy to deceive.  
AC: Really?  
AA: Yes. What about you?  
AC: I just got some.  
AA: What kind of insurance?  
AC: Hospitalization insurance. I considered a savings-based one.  
AA: Hospitalization insurance is necessary these days.  
AC: Does it cover coronavirus?  
AA: If it's excluded, that would be terrible.  
AC: Have you ever been hospitalized?  
AA: No, I am healthy.  
AC: That's good! I've been hospitalized once.  
AA: Why were you hospitalized?  
AC: Appendicitis. It was quick, but COVID-19 would take longer.  
AA: That must have been painful.  
AC: It got better soon. COVID-19 hospitalization can be weeks.  
AA: True. Hospital beds are also limited.  
AC: The situation is bad right now.  
AA: It's fully booked and dangerous.  
AC: I need to be careful.  
AA: Even with caution, things can happen.  
AC: Building physical strength and good nutrition helps.  
AA: Let's stay prepared. Thank you.  
AC: Thank you!

AC: Hello. Thanks for your hard work!  
AA: Hello! Thank you for your hard work!  
AC: Did you do anything today?  
AA: I went shopping today.  
AC: What did you buy?  
AA: I didn't buy vegetables as I planned.  
AC: Were they expensive?  
AA: The price wasn't what I expected.  
AC: Prices have been rising lately.  
AA: Yes, everything is more expensive.  
AC: Summer vegetables should be cheaper now.  
AA: The heat might be causing price increases.  
AC: That could be it. Do you cook for yourself?  
AA: I cook a little.  
AC: Nice! Are you good at it?  
AA: Not really. I'm not great with flavors.  
AC: When I cook, I make it to my own taste.  
AA: Same here. My family sometimes looks confused.  
AC: Do you use recipes?  
AA: If I'm lazy, it doesn't turn out well.  
AC: Do you taste as you go?  
AA: Yes, but it still tastes strange.  
AC: Do you adjust it then?  
AA: It gets worse when I try to adjust it.  
AC: Taste can change with temperature.  
AA: You must be good at cooking.  
AC: Not really. I rely on mentsuyu.  
AA: Mentsuyu is amazing.  
AC: Yes, it's essential.  
AA: I agree! Thank you.

AC: Hello!
AA: Hello! How can I assist you today?
AC: Have you been to an amusement park lately?
AA: I have not. Have you?
AC: Me neither. I want to visit places like Disneyland.
AA: I heard Disneyland was less crowded during COVID.
AC: That makes it a good target.
AA: It was by appointment only for a while, but not anymore.
AC: Ah, so it was reservation-only at some point.
AA: Yes, it was quite empty then.
AC: I can't imagine an empty Disneyland!
AA: Usually, there's always a long wait.
AC: Yes! No lines would make the day very fulfilling.
AA: It would. Do you prefer Disneyland or DisneySea?
AC: I've never been to DisneySea.
AA: Is that so? 
AC: Yes, I used to live very close by, and the fireworks from Disney or DisneySea happened every night.
AA: Near Maihama, correct?
AC: Yes, when it's close, I hesitate to go. But from afar, I want to visit.
AA: Locals often visit nearby attractions less frequently.
AC: Yes, that's why I've never been to Tokyo Tower.
AA: Where do you live now?
AC: I'm at the westernmost tip of Kyushu.
AA: That sounds like a big change.
AC: It is! I miss Mount Fuji.
AA: Are you in Kagoshima?
AC: It's in that direction. Sakurajima is not close by.
AA: I will visit Kagoshima in October.
AC: Enjoy! The food there is delicious.
AA: Thank you for the information.

AC: Hello, nice to meet you.
AA: Hello, nice to meet you.
AC: Do you participate in hometown tax donations?
AA: Considering it. Have you done it?
AC: Yes.
AA: What did you get?
AC: Aladdin's toaster.
AA: Available too?
AC: Yes, for 2000 yen.
AA: Which city?
AC: Hyogo. They make graphite heaters.
AA: Through Rakuten?
AC: Yes.
AA: Many options.
AC: Found it while searching.
AA: Efficient. Got toaster, supported country.
AC: Yes, and earned points.
AA: Many campaigns. Expenses increase.
AC: Shopping intense.
AA: Finding more to buy.
AC: Common.
AA: Why?
AC: Effective marketing.
AA: Strategic.
AC: One-day coupons surprising.
AA: Strategic expiration.
AC: Yes, careful not to buy too much.
AA: Understood. Thank you.

AC: Hello!  
AA: Good evening.  
AC: Oh, is it already that time?  
AA: Yes, it's around 5 o'clock now.  
AC: The days have indeed become shorter recently.  
AA: Correct, the evening chime rings around this time.  
AC: Will the chime ring here?  
AA: It doesn't ring in areas with fields.  
AC: Is it different elsewhere?  
AA: Yes, it varies by location.  
AC: I remember hurrying home when I heard the chime as a child.  
AA: There was a curfew then, right?  
AC: Yes, we often lost track of time playing outside.  
AA: Indeed, time flies when you're having fun.  
AC: If I didn't have a watch, I'd ask strangers for the time.  
AA: People were more approachable back then.  
AC: Now, people are wary of strangers.  
AA: Safety concerns have increased over time.  
AC: I try to avoid staring at children to avoid misunderstandings.  
AA: Social norms have changed significantly.  
AC: It used to be normal for strangers to scold us.  
AA: There was more communal interaction.  
AC: So nostalgic.  
AA: Yes, times have changed.  
AC: I miss when strangers gave us candy or tangerines.  
AA: Such gestures were common in the past.  
AC: Showa era, totally Showa era!  
AA: Yes, it was a different time.  
AC: Goodbye!  
AA: Take care!

AC: Good evening.  
AA: Good evening.  
AC: Have you decided on dinner tonight?  
AA: Not yet. Still thinking.  
AC: Tough choice, meat or fish?  
AA: Meat.  
AC: Chicken sounds good.  
AA: Chicken is healthy and inexpensive. Cheap! Cheap!!  
AC: Got it.  
AA: Living alone, I've learned the importance of affordability.  
AC: I often buy chicken breast because it's cheap.  
AA: Breast meat is definitely a good choice. Do you prefer fish or meat?  
AC: I like grilled fish, like Pacific saury.  
AA: Grilled saury is great in autumn.  
AC: It pairs well with rice and beer.  
AA: That's the perfect autumn meal.  
AC: Autumn has many tasty foods and fruits.  
AA: Yes, autumn offers a variety of delicious options.  
AC: New rice is also in season.  
AA: True.  
AC: It's very tasty.  
AA: Recently, I had some expensive rice that was exceptionally good.  
AC: Was it branded?  
AA: Yes, from a rice shop. The quality was evident immediately.  
AC: What brand was it?  
AA: Milky Queen.  
AC: Sounds delicious. Was it from Hokkaido?  
AA: I'm not sure, but the packaging was luxurious.  
AC: I'll try it this fall.  
AA: Definitely.
